segment.source: Instructions about how to remove sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list.
segment.target: Instructions about how to remove sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list.

segment.source: Remove sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Remove sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Remove sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list
segment.target: Remove sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: Remove websites that were added to a local Enterprise Mode site list by mistake or because the sites no longer have compatibility problems.
segment.target: Remove websites that were added to a local Enterprise Mode site list by mistake or because the sites no longer have compatibility problems.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The changes described in this topic only impact sites added to a local Enterprise Mode site list and not the list of sites deployed to all employees by an administrator.
segment.target: The changes described in this topic only impact sites added to a local Enterprise Mode site list and not the list of sites deployed to all employees by an administrator.

segment.source: Employees can't delete sites added to the list by an administrator.
segment.target: Employees can't delete sites added to the list by an administrator.

segment.source: To remove single sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list
segment.target: To remove single sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list

segment.source: Open Internet Explorer 11 and go to the site you want to remove.
segment.target: Open Internet Explorer 11 and go to the site you want to remove.

segment.source: Click Tools, and then click Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: Click Tools, and then click Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: The checkmark disappears from next to Enterprise Mode and the site is removed from the list.
segment.target: The checkmark disappears from next to Enterprise Mode and the site is removed from the list.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the site is removed by mistake, it can be added back by clicking Enterprise Mode again.
segment.target: If the site is removed by mistake, it can be added back by clicking Enterprise Mode again.

segment.source: To remove all sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list
segment.target: To remove all sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list

segment.source: Open IE11, click Tools, and then click Internet options.
segment.target: Open IE11, click Tools, and then click Internet options.

segment.source: Click the Delete button from the Browsing history area.
segment.target: Click the Delete button from the Browsing history area.

segment.source: Click the box next to Cookies and website data, and then click Delete.
segment.target: Click the box next to Cookies and website data, and then click Delete.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This removes all of the sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list.
segment.target: This removes all of the sites from a local Enterprise Mode site list.
